input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Tanning salon treatment has a direct effect on foot size. Going to the beach has a direct effect on foot size. For people not using tanning salon treatments, the probability of large feet is 23%. For people who went to tanning salons, the probability of large feet is 71%. For people who went to tanning salons, would it be less likely to see large feet if the person had not had a tanning salon treatment?
